result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Paul R Kiedrowski was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Paul R Kiedrowski was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program after serving 1 year of Initial Confinement.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year of Initial Confinement.
Apply 40 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision and to be paid BEFORE costs, fees or fines.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
DNA surcharge ($250) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  Court costs are waived.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate per Agent.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances.
No contact with any citizen victim or witness listed in the criminal complaint.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel.

supervisions.notes: Fine ($1179) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

DNA surcharge ($200) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.    Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Department and to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Straight Time.
Apply 40 days credit.
Concurrent with: Count 1.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Plea hearing on March 14, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
The state requests of the court permission to file an amended information adding the PAC charge.

Defendant Paul R Kiedrowski in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B. Broughton.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Broughton is request a plea date.  The state requests of the court permission to file an amended information adding the PAC charge.
The defense does not object.  The court grants the permission to file the amended information.  Defense acknowledges the filing and waives further reading and a NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  
  Plea hearing scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
Hearing on March 5, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Paul R Kiedrowski in court, in custody, with attorney Joan Broughton.   Timothy F Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Atty. Broughton requests to address the issue of bail. State leaves the modification up to the court. Court denies the Motion for modification of bail.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 13, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Paul R Kiedrowski in court, in custody, with attorney Joan Broughton.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS. Attorney Broughton moves for reduction in bail. Court addressed bail motion by defense. State objects to bail motion. Court denies motion to modify bail.   Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness, owner of vehicle listed in the criminal complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program
